bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Grayson County was named for William Grayson, a delegate to the Continental Congress from 1784 to 1787 and one of the first two United States senators from Virginia. It was formed from Wythe County by a statute adopted on 7 November 1792. The county court first met on 21 May 1793. A portion of Patrick County was added in 1810. The county seat is Independence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Grayson County Records, 1800-1912 circa, includes records from the following series: Bonds,Commissions,Oaths; Court Records (includes petition for new courthouse, 1905); Fiduciary Records; Lunacy Records; Land Records (deeds)School Records (school reports, 1856-1857); Tax and Fiscal Records; Road and Bridge Records; Will of William D. Baldwin, 1898.
